name: CN Tower
description: The CN Tower is a 553.3 m-high concrete communications and observation tower in downtown Toronto, Ontario, Canada.

reviews.description: Amazing view of the city!
Great experience but a bit pricey.

name: Royal Ontario Museum
description: The Royal Ontario Museum is a museum of art, world culture and natural history in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.

reviews.description: Fascinating exhibits and beautiful architecture!
Great for families, lots to see and learn.

name: Casa Loma
description: Casa Loma is gothic revival-style castle in Toronto built from 1911-14 and a staple of Toronto tourism!

reviews.description: What a beautiful castle, love it!
I'm a big fan, although there is a lot of walking involved. (Difficult due to my weight)

name: Wingstop
description: Wingstop Inc. is an American international chain of restaurants that primarily sells buffalo wings. It is often noted for their poor quality and expensive prices.

reviews.description: I paid 20 dollars for 8 wings! (A lot of money for me)
It's alright but a bit pricey.

name: High Park
description: High Park is a municipal park in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. High Park is a mixed recreational and natural park, with sporting facilities, cultural facilities, educational facilities, gardens, playgrounds and a zoo.

reviews.description: Amazing view of nature within Toronto!
Lots to do! We went to the zoo and hiked around.

name: Eaton Centre
description: CF Toronto Eaton Centre, commonly referred to simply as the Eaton Centre, is a shopping mall and office complex in the downtown core of Toronto, Ontario, Canada. It is owned and managed by Cadillac Fairview.

reviews.description: Lots to buy and things to eat - fairly expensive.
I was turned out of a store when they refused to accept paying in cash! >:(

name: Aga Khan Museum
description: The Aga Khan Museum is a museum of Islamic art located at 77 Wynford Drive in the North York district of Toronto, Ontario, Canada. The museum is dedicated to Islamic art and objects, and it houses approximately 1,200 rare objects assembled by Shah Karim al-Husayni and Prince Sadruddin Aga Khan.

reviews.description: Very cool and curated selection!
I am not a huge fan - especially not with the drive it took to get there!

name: Kensington Market
description: Kensington Market is a walkable bohemian neighbourhood that draws artists and tourists to its indie shops, vintage boutiques and arts spaces. The Market is also home to a wide array of specialty grocers, bakeries and cheese shops. Hipsters frequent trendy bars, cafes and international restaurants that range from casual to fine dining. Students and families populate Victorian houses along tree-lined streets.

reviews.description: So much to do and all sorts of interesting shops to visit!
I love Toronto!!!

name: Little Canada
description: Little Canada, previously known as Our Home and Miniature Land, is a tourist attraction located in the basement of The Tenor, near Yongeâ€“Dundas Square.

reviews.description: Amazing view of the city!
Great experience but a bit pricey.

name: Niagara Falls
description: The CN Tower is a 553.3 m-high concrete communications and observation tower in downtown Toronto, Ontario, Canada.

reviews.description: Amazing view of the city!
Great experience but a bit pricey.

name: Canada's Wonderland
description: The CN Tower is a 553.3 m-high concrete communications and observation tower in downtown Toronto, Ontario, Canada.

reviews.description: Amazing view of the city!
Great experience but a bit pricey.
